title: Egypt
description: Western Egypt’s Libyan Desert could tell many tales. As a part of the Saharan desert, the largest hot desert on the planet, the Libyan Desert is blanketed with a sea of sand dunes that can grow up to 500-meters long. Formed by northeasterly trade winds, these dunes also contain Libyan Desert Glass, estimated to have formed ~26 million years ago.
theme:
SIMPLE. The beauty in the minimalist
expressions of our planet
